title: Lab Leak or Not? How Politics Shaped the Battle Over Covid’s Origin
description: A lab leak was once dismissed by many as a conspiracy theory. But the idea is gaining traction, even as evidence builds that the virus emerged from a market.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Putin and Xi to Meet in Moscow
description: Also, Donald Trump says his arrest is imminent and UBS agrees to buy Credit Suisse.

title: A ‘New Cold War’ Looms in Africa as U.S. Pushes Against Russian Gains
description: The U.S. is reprising its playbook in Ukraine, where it has used classified information to expose plans by Russia. Next target: Chad.

title: Amid Violence, Israeli and Palestinian Officials Meet to Promote Calm
description: Fearing that an already-bloody year could worsen during Ramadan, Palestinians and Israelis met for the second time in a month.

title: Assad’s 2nd Diplomatic Trip in Days Speeds Easing of Isolation
description: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, welcomed in the Emirati capital with a 21-gun salute, is gradually re-emerging after the global shunning that followed his violent crushing of his country’s 2011 uprising.

title: Chaos Up Close
description: A look at the collateral damage of homelessness.

title: To Combat Food Shortages, North Korea Deploys the Military
description: Kim Jong-un, the country’s leader, has called for soldiers to be “a driving force” in increasing food production, a reflection of the North’s economic and geopolitical challenges.

title: China as Peacemaker in the Ukraine War? The U.S. and Europe Are Skeptical.
description: Chinese officials say Xi Jinping’s upcoming trip to Moscow is a peace mission. But U.S. and European officials say he aims to bolster Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Rishi Sunak Charts Post-Brexit Role With Pivot From ‘Global Britain’
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has dropped Boris Johnson’s bombastic approach to foreign policy, echoing the new British leader’s personal style and reflecting the country’s changed global status.

title: Defiant Putin Visits Mariupol, Second Stop in Tour of Occupied Ukraine
description: The surprise trip signals the Kremlin is trying to keep up business as usual, two days after an international court issued an arrest warrant for the Russian president.

title: In the U.S.-Led Iraq War, Iran Was the Big Winner
description: In the 20 years since the United States invaded Iraq, Iran has built up loyal militias inside Iraq, gained deep political influence in the country and reaped economic benefits. For Washington, these were unintended consequences.

title: Russia Is Closing In on Bakhmut, but Casualties Are High
description: Sending unarmed “diggers” into the front lines and near certain death, Russian troops are making slow but inexorable progress.

title: Defiant Putin Visits Mariupol, Second Stop in Tour of Occupied Ukraine
description: The surprise trip signals the Kremlin is trying to keep up business as usual, two days after an international court issued an arrest warrant for the Russian president.
